00037 
00038 // Custom events
00039 
00040 DECLARE_EXPORTED_EVENT_TYPE(AUDACITY_DLL_API, EVT_GRABBER_CLICKED, -1)
00041 
00042 class GrabberEvent:public wxCommandEvent
00043 {
00044  public:
00045 
00046    GrabberEvent(wxEventType type = wxEVT_NULL,
00047                 wxWindowID winid = 0,
00048                 const wxPoint& pt = wxDefaultPosition)
00049    : wxCommandEvent(type, winid)
00050    {
00051       mPos = pt;
00052    }
00053 
00054    GrabberEvent(const GrabberEvent & event)
00055    : wxCommandEvent(event)
00056    {
00057       mPos = event.mPos;
00058    }
00059 
00060    // Position of event (in screen coordinates)
00061    const wxPoint & GetPosition() const
00062    {
00063       return mPos;
00064    }
00065 
00066    void SetPosition(const wxPoint & pos)
00067    {
00068       mPos = pos;
00069    }
00070 
00071    virtual wxEvent *Clone() const
00072    {
00073       return new GrabberEvent(*this);
00074    }
00075 
00076  protected:
00077 
00078    wxPoint mPos;
00079 };
00080 
00081 typedef void (wxEvtHandler::*GrabberEventFunction)(GrabberEvent &);
00082 
00083 #define GrabberEventHandler(func) \
00084     (wxObjectEventFunction)(wxEventFunction)wxStaticCastEvent(GrabberEventFunction, &func)
00085 
00086 #define EVT_GRABBER(id, fn) \
00087     DECLARE_EVENT_TABLE_ENTRY(EVT_GRABBER_CLICKED, id, wxID_ANY, \
00088     (wxObjectEventFunction) (wxEventFunction) (wxCommandEventFunction) \
00089     wxStaticCastEvent(GrabberEventFunction, & fn), (wxObject *) NULL),
00090 
00091 // Specifies how wide the grabber will be
00092 
00093 #define grabberWidth 10

00104    // not a need to dock/float a toolbar from the keyboard.  If this
00105    // changes, remove this and add the necessary keyboard movement
